meanings.definition: To make something pagan in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: She tried to paganize the traditional ceremony by adding ancient rituals.
meanings.sent2: The ancient artifacts were paganized to fit the theme of the museum.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to paganize the recipe by using only ingredients from nature.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush paganized the blank canvas into a mystical scene.
meanings.sent5: The forest seemed to paganize the air with its earthy scents.

meanings.sent1: The missionaries worked hard to paganize the local tribes.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruler sought to paganize his kingdom, introducing new beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly tried to paganize the audience with a spell.
meanings.sent4: The music had a way of paganizing even the most skeptical listeners.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious book seemed to paganize anyone who read its pages.
